name: Building Societies Association
goal: The Building Societies Association or BSA is the voice for building societies and for some other mutual financial service providers.  Together these organisations serve over 25 million customers across the UK and have total assets of over £415 billion. Including their subsidiaries, they hold residential mortgage balances of over £330 billion - this equates to 23% of all outstanding mortgages in the UK. They also hold over £280 billion of retail deposits - 19% of all such deposits in the UK - including 37% of cash ISA balances. BSA members employ around 42,500 full and part-time staff and operate through 1,470 branches.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Fraud prevention
euInitiatives: All issues relating to financial services, company law and governance and consumer issues.
